title: Prince William's royal plans: No room for Harry and Meghan after becoming king?
content: Prince William is strategizing for his future reign by distancing himself from Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. An insider disclosed that William does not foresee a place for the Sussexes within the Royal Family, potentially leading to an irreversible separation. The rift between the brothers remains deep, especially after Harry's memoir, Spare.
summary: Prince William is strategizing for his future reign by distancing himself from Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. An insider disclosed that William does not foresee a place for the Sussexes within the Royal Family, potentially leading to an irreversible separation. The rift between the brothers remains deep, especially after Harry's memoir, Spare.

title: 'God made me do it': American mom accused of killing 2 of her children fights extradition
content: An American woman, Kimberlee Singler, accused of killing her two children in Colorado, claims God made her do it. Singler is fighting extradition to the US, arguing that a life sentence without parole violates European human rights law. The case involves a custody battle and allegations of coerced statements from her surviving daughter.
summary: An American woman, Kimberlee Singler, accused of killing her two children in Colorado, claims God made her do it. Singler is fighting extradition to the US, arguing that a life sentence without parole violates European human rights law. The case involves a custody battle and allegations of coerced statements from her surviving daughter.

title: Pakistan: Karachi residents grapple with 12-hour power outages due to illegal electricity sales, infrastructure issues
content: Residents in North Karachi suffer from prolonged power outages lasting up to 12 hours daily, disrupting their work and children's education. Illegal electricity connections in nearby slums worsen the situation. Despite efforts to improve the infrastructure, issues with Karachi Electric's aging systems and management persist, causing significant hardships for the community.
summary: Residents in North Karachi suffer from prolonged power outages lasting up to 12 hours daily, disrupting their work and children's education. Illegal electricity connections in nearby slums worsen the situation. Despite efforts to improve the infrastructure, issues with Karachi Electric's aging systems and management persist, causing significant hardships for the community.

title: US President Biden to host British PM Starmer next week, will discuss Ukraine and Gaza issues
content: President Joe Biden will meet British Prime Minister Keir Starmer next week to discuss key global issues including the Ukraine war and Gaza conflict. The talks will focus on supporting Ukraine against Russian aggression and seeking a ceasefire in Gaza. Other topics include Houthi rebel attacks and countering Chinese influence in the Asia-Pacific region.
summary: President Joe Biden will meet British Prime Minister Keir Starmer next week to discuss key global issues including the Ukraine war and Gaza conflict. The talks will focus on supporting Ukraine against Russian aggression and seeking a ceasefire in Gaza. Other topics include Houthi rebel attacks and countering Chinese influence in the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Russia’s election interference aims to boost Trump’s chances against Harris, warn US intel
content: US intelligence officials reveal that Russia is intensifying its efforts to influence the upcoming presidential election, targeting Donald Trump’s campaign against Vice President Kamala Harris. The interference operation involves sophisticated tactics, including using American media personalities to spread pro-Kremlin narratives and focusing on down-ballot races. Both campaigns have been briefed on these foreign influence activities.
summary: US intelligence officials reveal that Russia is intensifying its efforts to influence the upcoming presidential election, targeting Donald Trump’s campaign against Vice President Kamala Harris. The interference operation involves sophisticated tactics, including using American media personalities to spread pro-Kremlin narratives and focusing on down-ballot races. Both campaigns have been briefed on these foreign influence activities.

title: Watch: Boeing’s Starliner returns to earth without astronauts
content: Boeing's Starliner capsule returned to Earth without astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who remain on the ISS due to technical issues. The spacecraft faced thruster malfunctions and propulsion system leaks, causing NASA to delay their return until February 2025. Boeing will investigate these problems for future missions.
summary: Boeing's Starliner capsule returned to Earth without astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who remain on the ISS due to technical issues. The spacecraft faced thruster malfunctions and propulsion system leaks, causing NASA to delay their return until February 2025. Boeing will investigate these problems for future missions.

title: How the fight to define Kamala Harris will shape next week's debate
'Dick Cheney will be voting for Kamala Harris': Former VP turns his back on Trump, tells daughter Liz
content: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, a lifelong Republican, will vote for Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election, according to his daughter Liz Cheney. This unprecedented endorsement signifies a major break from his party and opposition to Donald Trump. The move highlights the deep divisions within the GOP regarding Trump's influence as other prominent Republicans also distance themselves from him.
summary: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, a lifelong Republican, will vote for Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election, according to his daughter Liz Cheney. This unprecedented endorsement signifies a major break from his party and opposition to Donald Trump. The move highlights the deep divisions within the GOP regarding Trump's influence as other prominent Republicans also distance themselves from him.

title: Thirteen Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes on Gaza, WAFA says
content: Israeli airstrikes on a school used as a refugee shelter and a residential building in Gaza resulted in at least 13 Palestinian deaths and 15 injuries. The Israeli military claimed the targets were Hamas command centers. This incident is part of an ongoing conflict that has caused massive casualties and displacement among Gaza's population.
summary: Israeli airstrikes on a school used as a refugee shelter and a residential building in Gaza resulted in at least 13 Palestinian deaths and 15 injuries. The Israeli military claimed the targets were Hamas command centers. This incident is part of an ongoing conflict that has caused massive casualties and displacement among Gaza's population.

title: Canada: Ontario’s first human rabies case in over 50 years linked to 'direct contact' with bat
content: Canadian province Ontario reports its first human rabies case since 1967, involving a Brantford-Brant resident exposed to a bat in the Timiskaming region. The patient is receiving treatment, and health officials urge those with direct bat contact to seek medical care. Close contacts are being assessed and offered post-exposure prophylaxis.
summary: Canadian province Ontario reports its first human rabies case since 1967, involving a Brantford-Brant resident exposed to a bat in the Timiskaming region. The patient is receiving treatment, and health officials urge those with direct bat contact to seek medical care. Close contacts are being assessed and offered post-exposure prophylaxis.

title: Trump rages against woman who accused him of sexual misconduct, dismisses groping allegations as ‘made-up’: 'Think of the impracticality'
content: Donald Trump vehemently denied sexual misconduct allegations from multiple women, including Jessica Leeds and E Jean Carroll, at a press conference. He called the lawsuits politically driven and part of a 'witch hunt.' His legal team is appealing a $5 million verdict related to Carroll's 1996 accusations.
summary: Donald Trump vehemently denied sexual misconduct allegations from multiple women, including Jessica Leeds and E Jean Carroll, at a press conference. He called the lawsuits politically driven and part of a 'witch hunt.' His legal team is appealing a $5 million verdict related to Carroll's 1996 accusations.

title: 'Cops in more danger': Trump vows to end 'Kamala's crime wave'
content: Former US President Donald Trump warned law enforcement officers about increased dangers under Vice President Kamala Harris's administration. He pledged to protect qualified immunity, enforce the death penalty for cop killers, and crack down on drug gangs. Trump criticized Harris for rising crime rates and vowed to end what he called 'Kamala's crime wave' if elected.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump warned law enforcement officers about increased dangers under Vice President Kamala Harris's administration. He pledged to protect qualified immunity, enforce the death penalty for cop killers, and crack down on drug gangs. Trump criticized Harris for rising crime rates and vowed to end what he called 'Kamala's crime wave' if elected.

title: Who is Marcee Gray? How domestic abuse and drug addiction led to her son Colt’s deadly school shooting
content: Marcee Gray, a former engineer from Georgia, is under public scrutiny after her son Colt was charged with murdering four people at Apalachee High School. The family's troubled history and Marcee's drug abuse are being investigated by authorities to understand their role in Colt's tragic actions.
summary: Marcee Gray, a former engineer from Georgia, is under public scrutiny after her son Colt was charged with murdering four people at Apalachee High School. The family's troubled history and Marcee's drug abuse are being investigated by authorities to understand their role in Colt's tragic actions.

title: JD Vance criticized for dismissing school shootings as a ‘fact of life’
content: JD Vance, Donald Trump's running mate, is under fire for his remarks on the Apalachee High School shooting in Georgia. Calling school shootings a 'fact of life,' he criticized Kamala Harris's gun control policies and suggested bolstering school security. His comments have drawn widespread criticism for oversimplifying the issue of gun violence.
summary: JD Vance, Donald Trump's running mate, is under fire for his remarks on the Apalachee High School shooting in Georgia. Calling school shootings a 'fact of life,' he criticized Kamala Harris's gun control policies and suggested bolstering school security. His comments have drawn widespread criticism for oversimplifying the issue of gun violence.

title: Missouri abortion-rights amendment could be axed from the ballot after ruling
content: A Missouri judge determined that an abortion-rights campaign did not meet legal criteria for the November ballot but permitted a last-minute appeal. The initiative aims to safeguard reproductive freedoms like abortion and birth control access. Similar amendments will be considered in nine other states this fall.
summary: A Missouri judge determined that an abortion-rights campaign did not meet legal criteria for the November ballot but permitted a last-minute appeal. The initiative aims to safeguard reproductive freedoms like abortion and birth control access. Similar amendments will be considered in nine other states this fall.

title: Pakistan: In blow to Imran Khan, SC restores changes in anti-corruption law
content: The Pakistan Supreme Court has reversed its prior ruling, reinstating amendments to the National Accountability Ordinance. This decision benefits the ruling coalition government while disadvantaging former Prime Minister Imran Khan. The court determined that Khan could not demonstrate the unconstitutionality of these amendments, thereby upholding appeals from both federal and provincial governments.
summary: The Pakistan Supreme Court has reversed its prior ruling, reinstating amendments to the National Accountability Ordinance. This decision benefits the ruling coalition government while disadvantaging former Prime Minister Imran Khan. The court determined that Khan could not demonstrate the unconstitutionality of these amendments, thereby upholding appeals from both federal and provincial governments.

title: 'Intent of slaughtering as many Jews as possible': Pakistani arrested for plotting terrorist attack in New York
content: A 20-year-old Pakistani national residing in Canada was arrested for plotting a terrorist attack on a Jewish center in New York City. Muhammad Shahzeb Khan planned the attack for October 7 and sought to kill as many Jewish people as possible in the name of ISIS. He faces charges of providing material support to ISIS.
summary: A 20-year-old Pakistani national residing in Canada was arrested for plotting a terrorist attack on a Jewish center in New York City. Muhammad Shahzeb Khan planned the attack for October 7 and sought to kill as many Jewish people as possible in the name of ISIS. He faces charges of providing material support to ISIS.

title: North Carolina court orders RFK Jr.'s name to be removed just before ballots are sent
content: A North Carolina appeals court has mandated the removal of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s name from state ballots for the presidential election after he suspended his campaign and endorsed Donald Trump. This ruling could influence the electoral dynamics in this key battleground state, just as absentee ballots were about to be mailed.
summary: A North Carolina appeals court has mandated the removal of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s name from state ballots for the presidential election after he suspended his campaign and endorsed Donald Trump. This ruling could influence the electoral dynamics in this key battleground state, just as absentee ballots were about to be mailed.

title: Hindus for America First endorses Trump: 'He is pro-India, Harris would be destabilizing’
content: Hindus for America First has endorsed Donald Trump and will campaign against Kamala Harris in key battleground states. The group raises concerns about Harris's potential impact on Indo-US relations, while praising Trump's pro-India stance, including his efforts to strengthen defense ties with India and acknowledge Hindu persecution globally.
summary: Hindus for America First has endorsed Donald Trump and will campaign against Kamala Harris in key battleground states. The group raises concerns about Harris's potential impact on Indo-US relations, while praising Trump's pro-India stance, including his efforts to strengthen defense ties with India and acknowledge Hindu persecution globally.

title: Turkish-American woman 'shot in the head' by Israeli forces during West Bank protest
content: Aysenur Ezgi Eygi, a Turkish-American activist, was killed by gunfire during an anti-settlement protest in Beita, West Bank. Her death has triggered global condemnation and calls for a thorough investigation. The UN accuses Israeli forces of the killing, with Turkey and the US demanding accountability and transparency from Israel.
summary: Aysenur Ezgi Eygi, a Turkish-American activist, was killed by gunfire during an anti-settlement protest in Beita, West Bank. Her death has triggered global condemnation and calls for a thorough investigation. The UN accuses Israeli forces of the killing, with Turkey and the US demanding accountability and transparency from Israel.
